title: Milan Živadinović
text:
Milan Živadinović (, ; 15 December 1944 – 17 July 2021) was a Serbian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and coach. He was also the scout for Ghanaian footballers for <a href="Southeast%20Europe">Southeast Europe</a>.In his homeland he was nicknamed Bard
Career.
Early in his coaching career, Živadinović was a student of <a href="Hugo%20Ru%C5%A1evljanin">Hugo Ruševljanin</a> under whose guidance he plied his trade. Throughout his career, he advocated that a <a href="2%E2%80%930%20lead%20is%20the%20worst%20lead">2–0 lead is the worst lead</a>.
His last appointment was as the head coach of <a href="Myanmar%20national%20football%20team">Myanmar</a> in 2011.
Death.
Živadinović died on 17 July 2021 at the age of 76.
Honours.
Red Star Belgrade
